title: Feature Suggestion - Add a button for setting current location
body:
Hey,
I have a feature suggestion for the app that would make it more useful for a lot of people. Where i live, most streets doesn't have a name, and as i need to add every place i visited into the calendar, it becomes pretty hard. I need to use Samsung Calendar right now, as it's the only calendar that has this option at the moment that i know of, and it breaks when MicroG is installed.
By adding a button next to the add location text that sets the current location of the phone for the event, a lot more people would use the app (me included), as this would probably the only open-source calendar app that would be able to do this.
Location permission shouldn't be asked at start, only after user presses on the button. 
Will update this post accordingly to replies.

title: Correct coding mistake
Crash - FileUriExposed
body:
[2018-11-05-07-23-24_etar.txt](https://github.com/Etar-Group/Etar-Calendar/files/2550220/2018-11-05-07-23-24_etar.txt)
Hi there,

I'm using xiaomi Mi 8 running Android 8.1.0 MIUI 10.0.2.0 and repeatedly get a crash every day when a recurring event reminder should get triggered. The event usually is expected to show in the notification bar and a notification sound I set in the preferences should play (sound was chosen from SD card).
Instead of playing the notification sound, Etar crashes, see log.

Note: I've solved such a problem before in syncthing-android . Android 8+ doesn't allow a file URI built from an absolute path like /storage/emulated/0/Ringtones/buff.ogg to be sent through an intent which worked fine on older Android versions.

Solution suggested: implement SAF for devices running Android 5+ using the file chooser dialog from Storage access Framework Action_get_document which will return a proper URI. Keep the existing way using rooted paths for phone before Android 5.x. 

Similar implementation if you cannot live without rooted paths to look at : https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing-android/pull/1170/files

title: Don’t include the ORGANIZER as implicit ATTENDEE in new events
body: When a new event is created, don’t implicitly include the ORGANIZER as ATTENDEE.  Possibly ask the organizer if she is attending and based on this include it.

title: All day events and Timezones (unexpected time offsets)
body:
So I use Etar as my calendar, but I have recently been implementing a "fit everything into a small space" calendar widget (to replace the unmaintained widget I had previously been using).

Something that surprised me was all day events having unexpected time offsets (not midnight to midnight as I had expected). In my case, all my events seem to have 10 hours added to the start and end times, which unsurprisingly matches my timezone (UTC+10). I'm not yet sure if the events themselves have a timezone set or if it's just the system timezone, or how the system is even supposed to be working...

A side effect of this 10 hour offset is that morning events (eg. my "catch the train" even at 7am) were displaying _before_ the "untimed" all day event - they come out of the DB first due to sorting by instance start time.

But I realised that I had seen this exact behaviour from Etar too. It displays all day events after any timed events that are before 10am on a given day.

If I find out how this is supposed to be handled (eg. it could be "find the timezone on the event and subtract the offset from the times") then I'll update this issue so that Etar can be fixed.

If any Etar devs happen to know how this should be handled, that would be great too.

title: Use dependency in xml to activate and deactivate checkboxes
How to add this project as a library to my project in Android Studio?
body:
I am trying to make this a module in my project but unfortunately, I can't because of too many errors like

Unable to resolve dependency for ':app@compileOptionsUnitTest/compileClasspath': Could not resolve project :Etar-Calendar.

I followed these steps by referring here https://github.com/MagicMicky/FreemiumLibrary/wiki/Import-the-library-in-Android-Studio:

**Method 1:**

1. Open your project in Android Studio
2. Download this project
3. Create a folder "subProject" in your project
4. Copy and paste the "Etar-Calendar" folder to your subProject folder
5. On the root of the project, the directory created the settings.gradle file. It should contain something like the following:
  include 'MyApp', 
  include ':subProject:Etar-Calendar'
7. gradle clean & build/close the project and reopen/re-import it.
```
dependencies {
//...
    implementation project(':subProject:Etar-Calendar')
}

```

**Method 2:**

1. Opened the project in Android Studio
2. Download this project
3. Go to File > Import Module and import the library as a module
4. Right-click your app in project view and select "Open Module Settings"
5. Click the "Dependencies" tab and then the '+' button
6. Select "Module Dependency"
7. Select "Etar-Calendar"

but same issues like "Unable to resolve dependency for ':app@compileOptionsUnitTest/compileClasspath': Could not resolve project :Etar-Calendar. "

title: Fix: Notification doesn't work with target SDK 27+ #372
Widget doesn't update when new day has come for target SDK 27+
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
By targeting `targetSdkVersion 27` Android has  [limits background execution](https://developer.android.com/about/versions/oreo/background) and which also limited the broadcasts receiver when the app is in background. 
Etar used `android.intent.action.PROVIDER_CHANGED` to update the date of the widget but now Android will not broadcast this when the app is in background. Only some [broadcasts exceptions](https://developer.android.com/guide/components/broadcast-exceptions) are there.

title: create new events for today by default
body:
When new event is created in monthly view for the current month by tapping the (+) button in the bottom-right corner its date is set to the 1st of the month which is useful only if today is the 1st of the month. Tapping today icon in the top right corner sets the initial date to today but entering and leaving daily view for any date resets it to the 1st again. 

proposed change: when monthly view for the current month is opened initial date for new events should be set to today, exiting daily view should keep its date as initial value for new events.

Android 8.1.0, Cat S61, Etar 1.0.13

body:
I might be blind but currently I can find no way of editing a single event in a series.

When editing an event it first asks whether I want to edit all events (I don't), or this event *and all future events*. However there seems to be no way of choosing just this one event to edit. Adding any data that is different from the other events seems to be impossible unless I edit this and all the following events, then go into next days event and revert my changes.

I can't seem to find an issue about it so maybe I'm just blind, but if I'm not it would be a nice thing to have.

title: Close the EditEvent view upon pause
body:
When switching apps, the onPause() function saves the current event. But
if the user switches back, the view is still open and if the save button
is pressed, two events are created. This closes the view, so the user
would have to open it again, to edit it.

An alternative solution would be to create the event only temporary and
not save it in onPause(), as discussed in #361.

title: Entered events disappear
body:
I have had this problem on several occasions, where I think I have entered an event, and later I find it has disappeared.

My first thought was that I was accidentally pressing Cancel instead of Done on creating the event. It is certainly true that the Cancel button could be smaller.

However, I am fairly certain this is not the real problem. In particular, I have only had the problem, as far as I am aware, when entering events in one physical location. This location happens to have poor data reception.

I have experienced this problem now about 5 or 6 times over several months, with two different phones.

On at least one of these occasions I saw the "Event created" message after entering it.

I am using version 1.0.13, on Oreo 8.0 on a Sony Xperia XZ1 Compact.

Thanks very much for Etar: it's a great improvement on Google Calendar with the dark theme and the lack of graphical backgrounds for appointments!

title: Year 2038 problem (32 bit unix time rollover)

I see the week of january 17-23, but flipping to the next page goes to december 1969.

In addition, the date selector for adding an event won't go past december 2036.

title: Adding better support for DTSTART/DTEND on ics import
body:
This PR aims to implement very basic support for the different forms allowed for date-time values (see [RFC 5545, section 3.3.5](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5545#section-3.3.5)) on the `DTSTART` and `DTEND` properties.

It does not implement any `VTIMEZONE` parsing, but relies on `java.util.TimeZone` to recognize the `TZID` given in the ics-file (which hopefully follows some standard naming conventions).

I'm aware this isn't the best solution, but at least it should handle a wider range of ics files correctly (up to now, only the UTC form is recognized). To support the whole specification, it would be much better to use some third-party ics parsing library, imho.

Fixes #277.

title: Etar crashes when trying to view event details
body:
Sorry for the fuzz, clicked the wrong button.
Etar Version: 1.0.13, Device: Samsung SM-T858 (Galaxy TabA 2016), Android 7.0 with latest patches from samsung. No root.
Installed using F-Droid.
Issue: open etar, go to weekly/daily view, select an event to view details. Etar crashes repeatedly. Creating an event works. Viewing an just created event does crash Etar.
Expected Behaviour: selecting an event shows the details of the event in an pop-up, like in 1.0.12.
What i tried to solve the issue:
-   re-installed etar: still crashes
-   checked the rights: all given
-   cleared the cache/data: still crashes
-   downgraded to 1.0.12: works like expected
-   upgraded back to 1.0.13: continues crashing


So I downgraded to 1.0.12 and blocked upgrades, to have a working version.

title: No notification sound on event reminder
body:
When I create an event and set a reminder, e.g. 15min before, I **get the notification**; phone also vibrates. However the notification does not ring. I'm on Android 8.0.0, Sony Xperia XZ1.

Notification sound is set up in Etar, and play when I select it in the settings. But when the notification is actually fired -- no sound, just vibration and visual notification. This is both with screen locked and unlocked. Of course I get notification sound from other applications. Etar has complete permissions, for notifications and everything else.

title: Add missing permissions in app
label: [Label(name="easy")]
body:
Some places in the app request data that needs permission without knowing if the permission is granted. Here is the Lint result:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/871079/40273352-770076a0-5bc7-11e8-94ae-d53742672701.png)
Note: This may not be correct for some cases because Lint doesn't recognize if you did a permission check in a way that it doesn't know. In that way we need to suppress the warning

title: Add an intermediate dark theme, rename the old dark theme to "black"
body:
Many other Android apps have a dark grey *dark* theme and a completely black AMOLED-friendly *black* theme. This duplicates the existing "dark" theme, adding a more standard dark grey theme.

This has the same shortcomings (some unthemed elements remaining white) as the existing "dark" theme, but I hope that it can be built upon.

# Screenshots

| Existing dark / new black theme | New dark theme |
|:-:|:-:|
| ![old dark theme / new black theme](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3159813/39969352-676ac316-56d2-11e8-9b6a-410545e0ebb3.png) | ![new dark theme](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3159813/39969350-651765c4-56d2-11e8-94bf-c7d0f8af67a6.png) |

title: Advanced repeat options needed to schedule all observances
body:
* Free Speech Week: 3rd full week of October each year -- This is a **from**/**to** event
* Document Freedom Day (DFD): Last Wednesday of each March
* Hardware Freedom Day (HFD): 3rd Saturday of each April
* Culture Freedom Day (CFD): 3rd Saturday of each May
* Software Freedom Day (SFD): 3rd Saturday of each September

It will be possible to schedule these events and similar events if you make it possible to repeat either select the calendar in **From** and **To** or:

* Repeat monthly:
** on the same weekday -- implemented
** on every **first** weekday -- not implemented
** on every second weekday -- implemented
** on every **third** weekday -- not implemented
** on every **fourth** weekday -- not implemented
** on every **last** weekday -- not implemented

* Repeat every **x** year:
** on the **x** week  -- not implemented
** on the **same** weekday of **month**  -- not implemented
** on every **first** weekday of **month** -- not implemented
** on every **second** weekday of **month**  -- not implemented
** on every **third** weekday of **month** -- not implemented
** on every **fourth** weekday of **month** -- not implemented
** on every **last** weekday of **month** -- not implemented

title: calendar: fix first notification after boot
body:
AlertService.java has some workaround code for OEMs that
messed up ACTION_EVENT_REMINDER alarms in CalendarProvider by using
an additional EVENT_REMINDER_APP_ACTION alarm. The correct
working of EVENT_REMINDER is detected when the event fires the
first time, and it's saved in a preference item, however not loaded
during init, thus the first calendar event after boot will get
both EVENT_REMINDER and EVENT_REMINDER_APP events.  The result is that
the second event acts as a quiet update which cancels the playback
of the notification sound.  The sound is either not played at all
or starts playing but is cut off after a fraction of a second.

logcat excerpt:
11-30 08:50:02.255  3197  3197 D AlertReceiver: onReceive: a=android.intent.action.EVENT_REMINDER Intent { act=android.intent.action.EVENT_REMINDER dat=content://com.android.calendar/1512028200000 flg=0x14 cmp=com.android.calendar/.alerts.AlertReceiver (has extras) }
11-30 08:50:02.287  3197  3197 D AlertReceiver: onReceive: a=com.android.calendar.EVENT_REMINDER_APP Intent { act=com.android.calendar.EVENT_REMINDER_APP flg=0x14 cmp=com.android.calendar/.alerts.AlertReceiver (has extras) }
11-30 08:50:02.526  2216  7876 D RingtonePlayer: PLAY
11-30 08:50:02.529  3197  7857 D AlertService: Posting individual alarm notification, eventId:62, notificationId:1, LOUD, high-priority
11-30 08:50:02.654  3197  7857 D AlertService: Posting individual alarm notification, eventId:62, notificationId:1, quiet, high-priority
11-30 08:50:02.660  2216  7433 D RingtonePlayer: stopAsync()

Change-Id: I4f420c9804e88eb75bb5c5cce16665190e08e91a

(cherry picked from commit bf88827)

title: Summer time problem in Centralno European time zone
body:
Hi!

I am not sure if other time zones have the same issue, but currently time on all my clocks and in my country (and in all central Europe) is the same and they show 8:52. But you've already known that. However, when I check time for CET in Etar it shows 7:52. Next time zone shows 9:52. Where did we lost an hour?

It seems that it still uses summer time, and we changed it last month to winter time. Maybe if it is not possible to changed that by the software, you could let user change it manually.

However, wrong time had been shown during the summertime also. 6:00 would be in Etar, 8:00 on my phone. On the calendar there is no problem. Events are in good position. The problem occurs in the description of an event and in notifications. It's not a bih deal, but It's annoying.

Etar version 1.0.12
Android 4.4

title: DAVdroid & ACCESS_CONFIDENTIAL
body:
Hello Etar-Team,

DAVdroid is an open source sync adapter on Android for CalDAV and CardDAV. We've implemented a new feature recently which would also be cool to use in Calendar apps like Etar.

On the server side a user can already set the visibility for an event (Server default, PUBLIC, PRIVATE or CONFIDENTIAL). On Android only DEFAULT, PUBLIC and PRIVATE are used. But there is a field for CONFIDENTIAL internally. We don't know any calendar app supporting this 4th setting (CONFIDENTIAL). As said before servers already use this, for example Nextcloud and others. It's only missing on the Android side.

Nevertheless this field is now able to be synchronized and stored with DAVdroid, so for the users it would be great if they could edit or create events containing this visibility setting, too. 

We're currently workarounding this as for non-capable calendar apps. It can be read here:

https://www.davdroid.com/manual/#c41

Of course this is just a small enhancement, but it would be great to have :-)

Thank you for your work on Etar!

title: Be able to change default event duration
body: I make a lot of half-hour events. It would be great if we could pick how long the default event should last.

title: Event creation leaves a duplicate event when Android's foreground is interrupted by another app
body:
1. Start adding details to a new calendar event, but don't save anything about it. Stay on the editing page
2. Let the screen get interrupted by an app that takes over the foreground, like an alarm or something
3. Once you deal with that and return to Etar, the current page will actually be for a new unsaved event. So if you save this one, the calendar will show two copies of the event.

#3 should open the original event, not a copy.

title: Modifying the date of a series only works on the first item
body:
If I have an event repeating each week and I would like to modify its starting date, I seems that:
* I can do it by finding the first instance of the series, opening it (by choosing to modify all the instances of the series) and editing the starting date.
* If I try to do it by opening any other instance of the series (and choosing to modify all the instances of the series when prompted), the modification of the starting date is not applied. For example, if I have an event every Saturday starting the 26 of August, and modify the whole series by editing the one of the 9 of September (to the value "_2 of Septemper_"), then the series will still start the 26 of August. Other software I know (ex: KOrganizer in KDE) actually modify the starting date of the series in such a case. Note that if I modify in Etar any other field (time of the day, description), the modification is successful for the whole series.

title: Cannot run Etar from f-droid the first time
body:
**Scenario**:
- Install Etar from f-droid applications manager
- Launch Etar from f-droid.
- You are asked in a pop-up to give calendar access (click yes)

**Actual result**:
- A "_screen overlay detected_" pop-up dialog is displayed, asking me to give Etar such a rights. Click on the button of the pop-up.
- You are redirected to the Android "_draw over other apps_" system settings screen but there cannot change the overlay right for Etar
- Leave the settings. Etar is not launched.

**Expected result**:
After having accepted to given the app access to the user calendar, Etar should be fully started.

**Alternative scenario**:
Like the original scenario, but by launching Etar from the Android applications list.

**Additional notes**:
It did not happen all the times when I repeated this scenario (must most of the times). Going in the Android application management and giving the Calendar, Contacts and Storage rights solved the issue. In some other attempts, trying to run the app several times (from the application list) sometimes succeeded (rights were properly added after being prompted). 

Device: Samsung Galaxy S5 mini, Android 6.0.1
Etar version: 1.0.12 (f-droid)

title: Crashes when setting per-event color
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
Etar 1.0.12 crashes when setting an event color for a third-party (DAVdroid) calendar:

1. Set up a DAVdroid calendar with DAVdroid 1.7 (which now supports event colors)
2. Synchronize some colored events
3. Open Etar. It shows the colored events correctly.
4. Try to set a new color for an event.
5. Etar crashes:


```xml
    <!-- This is the label underneath the icon for Calendar -->
    <string name="app_label">"Agenda"</string>

    <!-- Shared Labels. These labels are shared among the activities. -->
    <skip/>
    <!-- This is the label for the title or name of an event -->
    <string name="what_label">"Objet"</string>
    <!-- This is the label for the location of an event -->
    <string name="where_label">"Lieu"</string>
    <!-- This is the label for the time of an event [CHAR LIMIT=30] -->
    <string name="when_label">"Date"</string>
    <!-- This is the label for the timezone of an event [CHAR LIMIT=30] -->
    <string name="timezone_label">"Fuseau horaire"</string>
    <!-- This is the label for the Guests/Attendees of an event -->
    <string name="attendees_label">"Invités"</string>
    <!-- Text to show when an event starts on the current day -->
    <string name="today">"Aujourd\'hui"</string>
    <!-- Text to show when an event starts on the next day -->
    <string name="tomorrow">"Demain"</string>
    <!-- Text for an event starting on the current day with a start and end time.
         For ex, "Today at 5:00pm-6:00pm" [CHAR LIMIT=NONE] -->
    <string name="today_at_time_fmt">"Aujourd\'hui, <xliff:g id=\"TIME_INTERVAL\" >%s</xliff:g>"</string>
    <!-- Text for an event starting on the next day with a start and end time.
         For ex, "Tomorrow at 5:00pm-6:00pm" [CHAR LIMIT=NONE] -->
    <string name="tomorrow_at_time_fmt">"Demain, <xliff:g id=\"TIME_INTERVAL\" >%s</xliff:g>"</string>
    <!-- Format string for a date and time description.  For ex:
         "April 19, 2012, 3:00pm - 4:00pm" [CHAR LIMIT=NONE] -->
    <string name="date_time_fmt">"<xliff:g id=\"DATE\" >%s</xliff:g>, <xliff:g id=\"TIME_INTERVAL\" >%s</xliff:g>"</string>

    <!-- Some events repeat daily, weekly, monthly, or yearly.  This is the label
         for all the choices about how often an event repeats (including the choice
         of not repeating). -->
    <string name="repeats_label">"Fréquence"</string>
    <!-- Title of event when no explicit title is specified by the user -->
    <string name="no_title_label">"(Sans titre)"</string>

    <!-- Reminder format strings -->
    <plurals name="Nminutes">
        <!-- This is the label for a 1-minute reminder. -->
        <item quantity="one">"1 minute"</item>
        <!-- This is the label for 2 or more minutes. The actual number of
             minutes is a parameter. -->
        <item quantity="other">"<xliff:g id=\"COUNT\" >%d</xliff:g> minutes"</item>
    </plurals>
    <!-- We use the abbreviation "mins" instead of "minutes" to keep the string short.
         This is the number of minutes displayed for a calendar reminder.  For example,
         a reminder of 10 minutes would be displayed as '10 mins'.  The translation
         should use the shortest acceptable abbreviation to save space. -->
    <plurals name="Nmins">
        <!-- This is the label for a 1-minute reminder. -->
        <item quantity="one">"1 min"</item>
        <!-- This is the label for 2 or more minutes. The actual number of
             minutes is a parameter. -->
        <item quantity="other">"<xliff:g id=\"COUNT\" >%d</xliff:g> min"</item>
    </plurals>
    <!-- This is the number of hours displayed for a calendar reminder.  For example,
         a reminder of 1 hour would be displayed as '1 hour'.  The translation
         should use the shortest acceptable abbreviation of 'hour' to save space. -->
    <plurals name="Nhours">
        <!-- This is the label for a 1-hour reminder. -->
        <item quantity="one">"1 heure"</item>
        <!-- This is the label for a reminder of 2 or more hours. The actual number of
             hours is a parameter. -->
        <item quantity="other">"<xliff:g id=\"COUNT\" >%d</xliff:g> heures"</item>
    </plurals>
    <!-- This is the number of days displayed for a calendar reminder.  For example,
         a reminder of 2 days would be displayed as '2 days'.  The translation
         should use the shortest acceptable abbreviation of 'day' to save space. -->
    <plurals name="Ndays">
        <!-- This is the label for a reminder of 1 day. -->
        <item quantity="one">"1 jour"</item>
        <!-- This is the label for a reminder of 2 or more days. The actual number of
             days is a parameter. -->
        <item quantity="other">"<xliff:g id=\"COUNT\" >%d</xliff:g> jours"</item>
    </plurals>
    <!-- This is for displaying the week of the year near the date. Eg. "January, 2011 Week 1" -->
    <plurals name="weekN">
        <!-- Label for displaying week of the year for all week values [CHAR LIMIT=16] -->
        <item quantity="other">"semaine <xliff:g id=\"COUNT\" >%d</xliff:g>"</item>
    </plurals>

Si vous venez d\'ajouter un compte, patientez jusqu\'à la fin de la synchronisation, puis réessayez."</string>

    <!-- A label in a multiple-choice list for the specifying that an event does

    <string name="does_not_repeat">"Événement ponctuel"</string>
    <!-- Part of a description of an repeating event. This part states the date when a repeating

    <string name="endByDate">"; jusqu\'au <xliff:g id=\"DATE\" >%s</xliff:g>"</string>
    <!-- Part of a description of an repeating event. This part how many times the event repeats.

    <plurals name="endByCount">
        <item quantity="one">"; une seule fois"</item>
        <item quantity="other">"; <xliff:g id=\"NUMBER\" >%d</xliff:g> fois"</item>
    </plurals>

    <plurals name="daily">
        <item quantity="one">"Quotidien"</item>
        <item quantity="other">"Tous les <xliff:g id=\"NUMBER\" >%d</xliff:g> jours"</item>
    </plurals>
    <!-- A label in a multiple-choice list for the specifying that an event

        <item quantity="one">"Hebdomadaire (le <xliff:g id=\"DAYS_OF_WEEK\" >%2$s</xliff:g>)"</item>
        <item quantity="other">"Toutes les <xliff:g id=\"NUMBER\" >%1$d</xliff:g> semaines le <xliff:g id=\"DAYS_OF_WEEK\" >%2$s</xliff:g>"</item>
    </plurals>

    <!-- The common portion of a string describing how often an event repeats,
         example: 'Monthly (on day 2)' -->
    <string name="monthly">"Tous les mois"</string>
    <!-- Calendar spinner item, to select that an event recurs every year. -->
    <string name="yearly_plain">"Tous les ans"</string>
    <!-- Example: "Monthly (on day 15)" -->

    <!-- Example: "Yearly (on April 15)" -->
    <string name="yearly">"Annuel (le <xliff:g id=\"DATES\" >%s</xliff:g>)"</string>
    <!-- This is a label for telling the user that this event repeats in
         custom (non-standard) way from the usual repeat rates (such as daily,
         weekly, etc.) and that the user cannot change this on the phone
         (but only on the web). -->
    
    <!-- This is a label for telling the user that this event repeats in
         custom (non-standard) way from the usual repeat rates (such as daily,
         weekly, etc.) and that the user cannot change this on the phone

    <string name="custom" product="default">"Personnalisé (non paramétrable depuis le téléphone)"</string>

    <!-- This is a choice in a list that the user sees when he tries to modify
```

title: Place attribute is only one line
body:
Is it possible to use a multiline textfield? e.g. for
````
foo street 42
12345 bar city
````

title: Show birthdays from contacts database
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently: "foo bar (*1900)"
Probably better: "117 foo bar (*1900)"

title: Calendar: Support display lunar/festival when Language is Chinese
body:
If the current language is set as Chinese,Calendar could display
the lunar and festival for month,week,and day view.

Change-Id: Ie6baff4257939e2a99fc173d57e18651618044b5

(cherry picked from commit 29b4d09)

```xml
         For ex, "Today at 5:00pm-6:00pm" [CHAR LIMIT=NONE] -->

    <string name="date_time_fmt">"<xliff:g id=\"DATE\" >%s</xliff:g>, <xliff:g id=\"TIME_INTERVAL\" >%s</xliff:g>"</string>

    <string name="repeats_label">"Repetición"</string>

    <string name="no_title_label">"(Sin título)"</string>

    <!-- Reminder format strings -->
    <plurals name="Nminutes">
        <!-- This is the label for a 1-minute reminder. -->
        <item quantity="one">"1 minuto"</item>
        <!-- This is the label for 2 or more minutes. The actual number of
             minutes is a parameter. -->
        <item quantity="other">"<xliff:g id=\"COUNT\" >%d</xliff:g> minutos"</item>
    </plurals>
    <!-- We use the abbreviation "mins" instead of "minutes" to keep the string short.
         This is the number of minutes displayed for a calendar reminder.  For example,
         a reminder of 10 minutes would be displayed as '10 mins'.  The translation
         should use the shortest acceptable abbreviation to save space. -->
    <plurals name="Nmins">
        <!-- This is the label for a 1-minute reminder. -->
        <item quantity="one">"1 minuto"</item>
        <!-- This is the label for 2 or more minutes. The actual number of
             minutes is a parameter. -->
        <item quantity="other">"<xliff:g id=\"COUNT\" >%d</xliff:g> minutos"</item>
    </plurals>
    <!-- This is the number of hours displayed for a calendar reminder.  For example,
         a reminder of 1 hour would be displayed as '1 hour'.  The translation
         should use the shortest acceptable abbreviation of 'hour' to save space. -->
    <plurals name="Nhours">
        <!-- This is the label for a 1-hour reminder. -->
        <item quantity="one">"1 hora"</item>
        <!-- This is the label for a reminder of 2 or more hours. The actual number of
             hours is a parameter. -->
        <item quantity="other">"<xliff:g id=\"COUNT\" >%d</xliff:g> horas"</item>
    </plurals>
    <!-- This is the number of days displayed for a calendar reminder.  For example,
         a reminder of 2 days would be displayed as '2 days'.  The translation
         should use the shortest acceptable abbreviation of 'day' to save space. -->
    <plurals name="Ndays">
        <!-- This is the label for a reminder of 1 day. -->
        <item quantity="one">"1 día"</item>
        <!-- This is the label for a reminder of 2 or more days. The actual number of
             days is a parameter. -->
        <item quantity="other">"<xliff:g id=\"COUNT\" >%d</xliff:g> días"</item>
    </plurals>
    <!-- This is for displaying the week of the year near the date. Eg. "January, 2011 Week 1" -->
    <plurals name="weekN">
```

Is there anything I can do for you? Donations, advertising the app, any tasks for non-developers?

Best regards
Foxi

title: Feature Request: Reduce portion of night hours & making text smaller (Week)
body:
- **Ability to reduce the size of hours X to Y in the week calender**
I always use the week-type calendar. As I obviously have most of my appointments between 9AM and 7PM, I sometimes wish to see these hours easier. I'd love an option in the settings that reduces the "block-size" of certain hours (e.g. midnight to 6AM) to the space of one or two blocks, instead of six blocks. Optionally adding a bold line between the timespan that has been reduced in size and the regular hours would be great.

- **Ability to reduce font size of event names in the week calender**
Another option that would be very beneficial is reducing the text size of event names in the week-type calendar. My eyes aren't that bad and although the current font size is not huge at all, I could easily read it if it'd be two sizes smaller, leaving more space for more letters of the event name.

Love the app <3

title: Request more permissions at run time
New items created twice, should update item after app switch
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Etar creates items twice in this situation:
- start creating a new item, fill in some details
- go to another app (e.g. your browser to copy event description or link)
- go back to Etar to paste the stuff, tap save

In that case the item is stored twice: once without and once with the copy-and-pasted info. Instead, I would expect Etar to remember it still had the thing open and that it should update the item rather than creating a new one.

Etar 1.0.10 (F-Droid)
Device: Fairphone 2
OS: Fairphone OS 17.04.8 (Android 6.0.1)

title: Handling the event STATUS property
body:
As noted in [this comment](https://github.com/Etar-Group/Etar-Calendar/issues/71#issuecomment-258080690), event statuses are not always handled correctly. I'm using Etar (1.0.10) + Davdroid (1.4.0.3-ose) + Owncloud (8.x), and I observe odd handling of the STATUS property:

1. Create event using third-party client (in my case, Lightning/Thunderbird) 
2. Edit event in Etar
3. Observe status is now "Tentative"

The problem appears to hinge on the original event not having any status specified:

![2017-03-23 13_52_18-new issue etar-group_etar-calendar - chromium](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1348834/24269836/fef5ef62-0fcf-11e7-9f02-5fdde067258e.png)


````
BEGIN:VEVENT
CREATED:20170323T202138Z
LAST-MODIFIED:20170323T202150Z
DTSTAMP:20170323T202150Z
UID:c2606d80-deab-4c5f-8a89-71ef56445976
SUMMARY:test event
DTSTART;TZID=America/Los_Angeles:20170330T140000
DTEND;TZID=America/Los_Angeles:20170330T150000
TRANSP:OPAQUE
CLASS:PUBLIC
END:VEVENT
````

After editing the event with Etar, there is a new property `STATUS` which has the (annoying) default value of `TENTATIVE`.

> Side note: a second new property `SEQUENCE` is also added, and the properties `LAST-MODIFIED` and `TRANSP` are both removed.

````
BEGIN:VEVENT
CREATED:20170323T202138Z
DTSTAMP:20170323T202520Z
UID:c2606d80-deab-4c5f-8a89-71ef56445976
SUMMARY:test event
STATUS:TENTATIVE
DTSTART;TZID=America/Los_Angeles:20170330T140000
DTEND;TZID=America/Los_Angeles:20170330T160000
SEQUENCE:1
CLASS:PUBLIC
END:VEVENT
````

The iCal spec does not indicate which, if any, value is the correct default for `STATUS` property. I believe the correct behavior on Etar's part is to ignore this property if it doesn't exist (not to create it and set it to an arbitrary value).

title: Allow user to squeeze display so that whole day is visible, amd omit …
body:
Allow user to squeeze display so that whole day is visible, amd omit some hour numbers if they get too close together.

I want to be able to see all my events in the week view, so that I can see if I have any commitments on a particular day. This is viable on devices with high resolution displays, provided you only show every n'th hour number if they get too close together. This patch saves the last cell height set by gesture in the preference, and then adjusts it for each day or week if there are fewer all day events at the top.

title: Set seconds to zero when creating new event
body:
Fixes #13.

When creating a new event using the FloatingActionButton the seconds of the current time are used instead of setting them to zero.  Afaik creating a new event by other means does not show this behavior.

Although seconds are never displayed in Etar it seems reasonable to set them to zero, especially since other programs, with which events are synced, might show them.

title: Wrong day is shown after editing all-day events
body:
Starting off in a day-perspective, when editing an all-day event, the view gets set to the day before the start day of the event, i.e. one day too early. 

Steps to reproduce:
- Create an all-day event, e.g. in six days
- After closing the dialog, the view gets set correctly to [in six days]
- Edit the event, do not make any changes
- After closing the dialog, the view gets set to [in five days]

Tested on 1.0.8

title: Whole-day event gets created one day too short
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When creating a whole-day event from e.g. Monday till Thursday, the event gets inserted as only from Monday until Wednesday, i.e. always one day too short.
The same happens when editing an event

Steps to reproduce:

- Create new event (all-day, from Monday till Thursday)
- Event gets added on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday
- Edit the event, save it without changes
- The event is now on Monday and Tuesday only.

Tested on 1.0.8

This is counterintuitive, since I normally would like to be able to change both dates independently.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create new event
- Edit the event
- Move the start date 
- The end date gets changed as well

Tested on 1.0.8

title: Fix height in month view
body:
Fixes #158.  I hope I didn't miss any side effects this time since the month view is quite complex.

The height of a box in the month view is calculated [here](https://github.com/Etar-Group/Etar-Calendar/blob/master/src/com/android/calendar/month/MonthByWeekAdapter.java#L264) using the formula `(parent.getHeight() + (parent.getTop() * 2)) / (mNumWeeks + 1)`.  The origin of this formula is not clear to me but apparently it sets the height such that _approximately_ `mNumWeeks` boxes are visible.
 
After commit 3ebc9c11fafb3baf212731ec3739ce4ad4c9e583 the toolbar is no longer scrollable and this reduces the result of `parent.getHeight()` leading to the behavior described in #158.  I think the reason is that with a scrollable toolbar the area occupied by the toolbar is included in `parent.getHeight()` since the toolbar could be removed by scrolling.

However, after making the toolbar unscrollable `parent.getHeight()` should give the actual size excluding the area occupied by the toolbar.  Thus, the correct height of the boxes can be calculated by the simple formula `parent.getHeight() / mNumWeeks` as done in this pull request.

This does not restore the exact original behavior but the height of the boxes is now calculated such that `mNumWeeks=6` boxes (and a tiny bit more if you look carefully) are visible.  In the original behavior approximately `mNumWeeks=6` boxes were visible (afaik it can be either more or less depending on the resolution). For comparison see the following screenshots.

Original behavior
![1_scrollable_toolbar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6775792/22906104/5daac74e-f243-11e6-8dfc-c4510243dff3.jpg)

After making the toolbar unscrollable
![2_noscrollable_toolbar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6775792/22906111/662691aa-f243-11e6-89b5-9d33770eee7e.jpg)

Unscrollable toolbar + this pull request
![3_fixheight](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6775792/22906131/74750c1e-f243-11e6-86fe-71224e7488a7.jpg)

I'd like to integrate this back into AOSP to replace the legacy Calendar application but it appears there are some changes to Android.mk that have broken this. 

I've replaced the Android.mk file with the one at https://github.com/Free-Software-for-Android/Standalone-Calendar/blob/standalone/Android.mk , which seems to actually build the file instead of copying over a prebuilt apk but now I'm getting the following error:

```
ninja: error: 'packages/apps/Calendar/assets/Graphic-ar.png', needed by 'out/target/product/bullhead/obj/APPS/Calendar_intermediates/package.apk', missing and no known rule to make it
```

A quick search shows this only appearing in the ./.git/index file, which makes me suspect it may be a problem with one of the subprojects. Any idea on how to fix this?

The change in all_in_one_material.xml disables the scrolling but this change alone will leave an empty gray area at the bottom.  Therefore it is required to remove the paddingBottom in day_activity.xml.

title: Toolbar is scrollable
body:
The toolbar can be scrolled upwards.  In the day and week view this creates an empty gray area at the bottom.  See the following screenshot:

It is even possible to scroll the toolbar upwards until it vanishes and in this case it's not possible to scroll down again.  I am not sure what the intended behavior is since the code looks like scrolling is activated explicitely.  I would prefer to simply disable the scrolling of the toolbar and can prepare a pull request if this is desired.

title: Improve "Map handling"
Permission READ_PHONE_STATE declared but not used
body:
Hello, I'm Denis Bogdanas, a research assistant at Oregon Stat University.
I'm working on a tool that automatically introduces runtime permission checks and requests for Android 6 apps. As part of this study I analyzed this app. I was looking at the way permissions are referred in the code.

This app declares permission READ_PHONE_STATE in the apk manifest, but doesn't have any code that requires them. It is possible that source code doesn't declare the permissions. I only analyzed apk builds from f-droid. Yet android build mechanism may introduce them when the app uses certain libraries:

https://commonsware.com/blog/2015/06/25/hey-where-did-these-permissions-come-from.html

It won't create any problems on Android 6, but on Android 5- users may wonder why the app needs these permissions and be skeptical of installing the app.

Do you think this is an issue?

best regards,
Denis

title: Configuration of reminders
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Please add options to configure the reminders of events. Only a limited number of predefined time are proposed. At least, an option could permit to choose the number of hours and the number of minutes of reminders instead of choosing in a predefined list.

title: Days per week setting yields unexpected behavior
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
In "week view" with the default "days per week" setting of 7 a swipe left or right moves the view to the next week with the days (Monday, Tuesday, etc.) in the same position. If the "days per week" setting is modified to 5 (so that more width is available per day) then swiping left or right causes the positions of the days to constantly change. This is visually inconsistent and makes the setting somewhat unusable (in my view).

It would be more intuitive if the week view was not forced to scroll by the amount specified in "days per week" but rather just smooth scrolled. Then when I scroll to the next week I can maintain a consistent position of the the days (i.e. Monday/Sunday on the left) or just choose whatever I feel I want. The app is forcing the position of the days which is annoying (in my view).

I can understand if this is the desired behavior. Maybe you can just add a setting for "smooth scroll week view". 

Thank you for your work! Awesome app and using it every day!

title: Improve "Map handling"
Process RSVP Intent Without Event Editor

Support sharing calendars via vcs and add ability to import/export from sdcard
Fix sound setting on Android 6 by not de-registering settings listeners
body:
Because choosing a sound is a separate activity on Android 6, the
onPause and onStop methods are called so the app doesn't observe
the settings values changing.

There doesn't seem to be a good reason to de-register from settings
listeners. I couldn't find any API notes or reference code that
indicated this should ever be done.

title: Use Android's white color
body:
This change is required before updating datetimepicker, since newer version no longer define the color white.

The rationale for updating datetimepicker is a bug where the system's vibrations settings are ignored (see #128).

title: Allow sharing of calendar events through an ics file
datetimepicker does not honor vibrate settings
body:
The dialogs for selecting the date and time in the activity to edit an event and in the "Go to..." dialog do always vibrate even when "Vibrate on tap" is disabled in the system settings.  This is a bug in the library [com.android.datetimepicker](https://github.com/xsoh/android_frameworks_opt_datetimepicker/tree/a62b3c24ea7bedc32de00567e430a706a6ec135c).

Fortunately this has been fixed in the CyanogenMod repository from which this library is forked from (it should also be fixed in your fork but not in the version included in this project).  Reading the commit log, [this](https://github.com/CyanogenMod/android_frameworks_opt_datetimepicker/commit/3fc32c45f5efc4ce4b91cbcdd925d9b30f67046e) should be the commit fixing this problem.  I compiled Etar with the [current version](https://github.com/CyanogenMod/android_frameworks_opt_datetimepicker/tree/66a7685e2e9a524989f840bd13217beeb3fc6342) (66a7685 at the time of writing) of datetimepicker and checked that the problem is indeed fixed.

So it would be great if you could update datetimepicker to fix this.

Note that the current version of datetimepicker requires a small change in Etar to work.  The version you use defines the color `@color/white`but this was later [removed](https://github.com/CyanogenMod/android_frameworks_opt_datetimepicker/commit/a09b3c940e98b8606a16a94b48b6d0121d9d3635) since it is already included in android as `@android:color/white`.  However, you use `@color/white` in res/values/styles.xml and res/values/themes.xml, so these should also be replaced with `@android:color/white`.  Apart from that I did not encounter any problems with the new version.

title: Add option to hide Contact's birthdays
body:
Contact birthdays are showed automatically, the problem is that with [Birthday Adapter](https://f-droid.org/repository/browse/?fdid=org.birthdayadapter) installed your calendars "Contacts birthdays" have to be hidden, otherwise duplicates of birthdays are being displayed; Unfortunately Etar do not have this option.

In S Planner you can hide them: S Planner -> Calendars -> Display -> Uncheck Contact's birthdays. Doing so did only hide Contact's birthdays in S Planner but not in Etar.

Its not possible to hide Contact's birthdays in Etar, can you please add that option?

title: What is the difference between Standalone Calendar and Etar?
body:
Standalone Calendar:
* https://github.com/Free-Software-for-Android/Standalone-Calendar
* https://f-droid.org/repository/browse/?fdfilter=Standalone+Calendar&fdid=org.sufficientlysecure.standalonecalendar

Fork of the AOSP calendar, mainly for those who would like to have it installed but can't. It has a different package name to prevent conflicting with “com.android.calendar”.

Etar:
* https://f-droid.org/repository/browse/?fdfilter=Etar&fdid=ws.xsoh.etar

Etar is material designed calendar based on the ASOP calendar.

title: Adding a word to dictionary during creation of a new event results in premature save of event into calendar
body:
To reproduce:
- Create a new event in Etar
- Enter a word which isn't in the current dictionary (as indicated by red underline)
- Tap on the underlined word to bring up drop-down spelling menu, and select 'Add to dictionary'
- An 'Add to dictionary' dialogue pops up. Choose 'OK'.

Your new word is added to the dictionary, but at the same time the new event is created and exists in the calendar, even though the create/edit event dialogue is still active. If you then finish adding details to the event and tap 'Done' to save it in the normal way, you'll find you have created two new events.

I'm running Etar version 1.0.6 running on Android 6.0.1.

I can try and do a mockup if this isn't clear.

title: Ability to set status of events

title: Display of tentative events
body:
Events can [be tentative](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5545#section-3.8.1.11). Would it be possible to make it configurable how they're displayed, e.g. using a lighter colour, or some other markup to help distinguish them?

Thanks!

title: Unable to hide cancelled events
body:
Events can [be cancelled](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5545#section-3.8.1.11). They then still show up like regular events. Would it be possible to make it configurable to (a) either hide them completely (like declined events), or (b) display them crossed out?

Thanks!

title: Unable to modify one event for repetitive events
body:
Hi,
1. Create a repetitive event (e.g nandroid backup every Monday at 9.00 am) from today to the end of the year)
2. Next Monday, you want to move the event at 10.00 am.
3. You can only modify this event and future events or future events. You can't only modify the event of next Monday.

Hope you see what I mean.
Thanks in advance.

title: Solves #56
Events don't sync with an external calendar
body:
Hi, I'm using Etar together with DAVdroid from f-droid repository.

There are some issues with syncing of events with an external server:
- If I add an event in Etar, it does not get synced with an external server.  I can see this event in a regular Calendar app, but need to manually sync the events either by using the regular Android Caledar's refresh or DAVdroid's sync button.
- Etar's refresh does not trigger DAVdroid sync with an external server.

To be honest, I don't know, if it's DAVdroid's or Etar's issue or both. I'm guessing Etar's because everything works well with the regular Android Calendar app.

Do you have an idea what is causing those sync problems?

Thanks for help!

title: Allow EditEventActivity to run over the lock screen
body:
I use a [lockscreen app](https://github.com/AChep/AcDisplay) that I've [modified](https://github.com/smichel17/AcDisplay) to include a shortcut for creating a new calendar appointment.

I'd like to be able to add the event without unlocking my device. I'm currently doing this by allowing etar to run over the lock screen with [xposed app settings](https://github.com/rovo89/XposedAppSettings). However, I don't really want the entire application to do this; just the EditEventActivity.

You can do this with `getWindow().addFlags(LayoutParams.FLAG_SHOW_WHEN_LOCKED)`.

However, I'm fairly new to android development and couldn't figure out how to add this property to the EditEventActivity only (I think I found the right place, in `onCreate` in [EditEventActivity.java](https://github.com/xsoh/Etar-Calendar/blob/master/src/com/android/calendar/event/EditEventActivity.java), but I ran into issues where adding the required dependencies didn't fix dependency errors and I'm not sure why).

title: Fix and complete the german translation
show two events with same UID only once
body:
As per [RFC5545](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5545#section-3.8.4.7) calendar event UID should be **globally unique**.

If I subscribe to two different calendars (say personal and team calendar) which share an event, only display this event once (doesn't matter which, since they are same) and NOT two apparently same events side-by-side.

can not delete weekly shift for Chistmas
body: I have my work schedule in my calendar with my Friday shift set to repeat weekly. I want to delete the shift for Fri 25Dec2015, because my employer doesn't want me to work that day. But the calendar only gives the options to either delete or edit that and all following members of the sequence or all members of the sequence. It does not give the option to delete or edit that one member.

title: Add information in About section
body:
In About section only build version is shown.
You can add name(s) of developer(s), link to Github and other infos

title: "Etar" name is not adopted everywhere
body: The name of the app is not used everywhere, i.e. in Settings you can read "About Calendar" instead of "About Etar"

title: Update README.md
body: Fixed errors, added Contribute section

title: calendar Go to Date button DATE || MONTH || YEAR
body:
Just have a simple Go to Date OR Jump to Date selector like in LG Phones stock Calendar app. Swiping and sliding is not good if someone wants to jump between 27 Jun 1986 Fri and 07 Oct 2015 Wed.
This is great when want to see a Day of Week on certain Date.
Solution:
DATE || MONTH || YEAR
01 || Jan || 1900 
Month will be shown in 3 Digit Jan, Jun... but when we Enter number 11 it should become Nov.
Year should be from 1900 to present.

title: Unable to edit calendar after event was saved
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi there,

thanks for the nice app, it's really good looking and nearly feature complete, one thing I'm missing is possibility to assign event to another calendar after saving it. 
Would that be possible to select a default calendar? or use last modified calendar as default for the next event?

title: The date is not updated in the widget
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
The date is not updated in the widget. The content is scrolled (but late in the day) but
the date on the header of the widget remains the same (in fact it is the date of the day I
added the widget on my screen)

Lolipop 5.0

title: Creating a new entry chooses arbitrary "second" values in times
body:
Etar doesn't have a field to enter the second (in start/end time) when creating/editing an entry.

The DTSTART (DTEND) values it writes to the Calendar Provider contain arbitrary seconds, i.e. if you enter start time "13:00", Etar writes "13:00:38" to the Calendar Provider.

I guess this is because the `Date` is created from the current time, and then the second is not set to zero.

title: FC under Marshmallow when selecting "Home time zone" in General Settings
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I get a FC every time I select "Use Home time zone" then "Home time zone".

"Home time zone" is defaulted to "Eastern Daylight Time GMT-4", yet my:

Settings -> Date & Time -> Automatic time zone

correctly defaults to "GMT-05:00 Central Daylight Time"

I'm also seeing this on the AOSP Calendar that builds with AOSP-6.0.0, so it's probably some change in Marshmallow.

I'm attaching images and a log data.

title: de.txt
body:
Etar ist ein im Material Design gestalteter open source Kalender für jedermann!
Besonderheiten:
*Monatsansicht
*Wochen, Tag und Agendaansicht.
*Benutzt Android Calendar sync. Arbeitet mit Google-Kalender, Exchange usw. zusammen.
*Frei, open source und frei von Werbung.

Bugs & feedback: https://github.com/xsoh/Etar-Calendar/issues
Source Code: https://github.com/xsoh/Etar-Calendar

title: Remove INTERNET permission
body: Works fine without. Closes: #9.

title: android.permission.INTERNET
body:
Hi,

do you really need android.permission.INTERNET in AndroidManifest.xml? A quick grep turned up nothing. Would be great to get rid of it.

Thanks for taking care of the calendar app!

title: More visible entries in month view
body:
Hey, really nice work here! I've been looking forward to a nice OSS Calender for quite a long time. Keep it up!

I think the month view could be further improved by reducing the paddings and margins around an appointment.
Thus, more Entries would be visible.
(aCalender does this)

Example: (aCalendar VS Ethar)
![acal_dez](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15049544/10393511/b4347872-6e90-11e5-83ad-9026642e2592.png)
VS
![etar_dez](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15049544/10393515/c1aeda88-6e90-11e5-8347-0bdbd1e7234c.png)

title: "Go to" menu option
body:
It would be handy to have a "Go to" menu option that let you select a day and jump directly to it.
I have already seen it implemented on others aosp based calendar.

title: Other calendars types?
body: Is there any plan to add other calendar types, like Hijri? If so, I think you can consider using a stripped down version of ICU4j library for the conversion calendar types like Hijri and Persian could be easily integrated.

title: All day events & events with more than one day should be shown in one row
label: [Label(name="ui")]
body:
All day events events & the events with more than one day should be shown in one row without reputation of the title in month view.
![device-2015-10-04-194439](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/871079/10268953/f5253696-6ad0-11e5-9433-37402c731184.png)

title: k9-mail E-Mail account support
body:
Hey there.

At first, thanks for your application. 

My question is if you could add k9-mail E-Mail Account support or if that would be rather impossible due to k9-mails' behavior not to add it's held accounts in the "Android Account Manager"?

Thank you very much for your work until now and in advance for your feedback.

Greetings :)

title: dark theme
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="ui")]
body:
Wow, thanks for the calendar first of all! A real improvement :)

If you do find the time, a dark Theme would be really nice! I know a lot of people who would love this and definitely switch because aosp doesn't have it...

title: F-Droid
body:
Would be nice to have this in the F-Droid-Repo.
Thank you for your hard work on this project. I really don't get along with the stock calendar.

title: Change the ActionBar subtitle to normal case letters
label: [Label(name="ui")]
body:
The subtitle in the ActionBar should be in normal case for better Looking

![subtitle in the ActionBar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/871079/9765059/f31714c4-571a-11e5-8461-1271543350d8.png)
